action: I want to receive real-time notifications for business anomalies and important events
reason: To respond immediately when problems occur and prevent business interruptions or losses
acceptance_criteria: Alert notifications are only receivable by authenticated users.
Viewing permissions for notification content are controlled per role.
Notifications are automatically generated upon system event occurrences.
Event types (Error / Warning / Information) can be distinguished.
Severity levels (Low / Medium / High / Critical) can be configured.
Immediate notification is triggered when a 'Critical' level event occurs.
Notifications are persistently stored in the database.
Notifications include event_id, occurrence timestamp, type, and severity.
Unread and Read statuses for notifications can be managed.
Read operations are managed on a per-user basis.
The read status of other users' notifications cannot be changed.
Notification deletion is implemented as a logical delete.
Deletion history is stored in the audit log.
Notifications are displayed in real-time on the Web UI (using WebSocket, etc.).
WebSocket connections perform authentication token verification.
Connections with invalid tokens are rejected.
Notifications also support email delivery.
Email destinations are based on user settings.
Retry processing is performed if email delivery fails.
An error log is recorded after three failures.
Notifications are compatible with push notification APIs.
Rate limiting prevents mass notification spam.
The notification generation API is REST-compliant.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Notification content is sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Notification logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
A notification history search function exists.
Search criteria can be filtered by period, severity, and type.
The search API performs authorization checks.
Internal system information is not included in the API response.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
Logs for successful notification generation are stored.
Logs for failed notification generation are stored.
Notification delivery processes are managed via an asynchronous queue.
Automatic retry is performed upon queue processing failure.
SLA monitoring target events are configurable.
Alerts are automatically generated upon SLA violations.
Notification templates are editable from the management screen.
Template change history is maintained.
API versioning is managed.
Target response time is within 500ms (excluding notification delivery).
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
